column4: wow... I just uncovered the hugeness of my ~/.thumbnails folder!!! which application created this monstrous cache??
perhaps nautilus?
/home /etc and /var would be a good start
but when you restore, you don't neccessarily need to restore /etc and /var.  they are great to have lying around, though.
have you done what I'm doing before?
reinstalled the OS?  plenty of times :)  every time my laptop has to go back to gateway for a repair, in fact
well, i always restore those, but if what you're looking for is that "factory fresh" feeling, i guess have at it
so how do you do the homedir backup?  tarball everything?  does that include the hidden files?
i prefer rdiff-backup, but you could do a tar cvf home.tar /home
that *should* work.
it's rdiff-backup
thanks for the rdiff-backup tip, I'm reading the man page now... any favorite combo of flags you could show me?
not really.  sometimes i will have it ignore caches and whatnot
but if i'm feeling lazy, i'll just let it go to town
and lately i've been very lazy :)
it's a great tool for doing daily backups
you ever tie it to a cron?
absolutely
you can change your version in about:config
i'm too lazy to do that.
since they know about the bug, they should let ubuntu users click through
but yes, that should do it
